Package pulse.problem.statements

Introduces various problem statements for the heat conduction problem in the laser flash experiment. Note that currently only one problem statement is enabled, which is the LinearisedProblem.
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    TwoDimensional  
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    LinearisedProblem
    The simplest problem statement supported in PULsE, which is formulated in the dimensionless form and with linearised boundary conditions.
    LinearisedProblem2D  
    NonlinearProblem  
    NonlinearProblem2D  
    Problem
    A Problem is an abstract class defining the general rules for handling heat conduction problems, and also providing access to the basic properties used in the calculation with one of the DifferenceSchemes.
    Problem2D  
    Pulse
    A Pulse stores the parameters of the laser pulse, but does not provide the calculation facilities.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Pulse.PulseShape
    The PulseShape, an instance of EnumProperty, defines a few simple pulse shapes usually encountered in a laser flash experiment.
